Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it was still produced more than 80 years ago! That's something and that's why I couldn't keep my hands off parodying it.
That said, one can see in this movie many forebears of certain cinema traits that were developed later. The shooting and camera moves. The false-disguising

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy sharecropping owners (they own the land) with enough money to emigrate off planet, live in luxury for themselves alone (Spann dishnow heavily emphasizes that point).
